title: How to Make a Vodka Screwdriver

steps.headline: Fill a highball glass with ice.
steps.description: You can use as much or as little ice as you'd like. If you are worried about the ice diluting the flavor, use some ice cubes made from frozen orange juice instead.

steps.headline: Add some vodka.
steps.description: You can use any type of vodka you like, but you might want to use a better quality, as a lower-quality one will stand out. If you find that vodka has too sharp of a taste for you, try using an orange-flavored vodka instead.

steps.headline: Top it off with orange juice.
steps.description: How much orange juice you add is up to you. Keep in mind that the more juice you add, the weaker the drink will become.

steps.headline: Give it a stir.
steps.description: When the Screwdriver was first invented, it was stirred with whatever the workers had on hand: an actual screwdriver. You might want to use a spoon, straw, or stir stick for this.

steps.headline: Garnish with an orange slice or a maraschino cherry.
steps.description: This is entirely optional, but it will help dress up an otherwise simple drink and make it look more interesting.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy the drink.
steps.description: It pairs great with greasy, breakfast type foods, such as bacon and scrambled eggs. You can also enjoy it with something salty, like pretzels.

steps.headline: Try it with a flavored vodka.
steps.description:
A Screwdriver is a very simple drink. You can add some complexity to it by using a flavored vodka (as opposed to plain or orange-flavored). Just about anything tropical will go well with the orange juice. Here are some popular choices to get you started:
Lemon
Melon
Pineapple
Red berry

steps.headline: Give it a bit of fizz with some soda water.
steps.description: Start off by mixing a regular screwdriver. At the very end, add a splash of soda water. Try to use freshly-squeezed orange juice for this. Use a thin orange slice for garnish.

steps.headline: For some kick, make it an Electric Screwdriver by add energy drink and tequila.
steps.description: Fill a glass with ice, then add ¾ ounce (22 milliliters) of tequila, ¾ ounce (22 milliliters) of vodka, and 2 ounces (60 milliliters) of orange juice. Top it off with 1 ounce (30 milliliters) of your favorite energy drink. Garnish it with an orange slice before serving.

steps.headline: Add some sage for an herbal screwdriver.
steps.description: Muddle a sage leaf with 1 shot of vodka in a cocktail shaker. Add 5 ounces (150 milliliters) of orange juice, a dash of Angostura bitters, and some ice. Shake to mix. Fill a glass with ice, and pour the mixture through a strainer over it. Use a sprinkle of freshly-ground nutmeg as garnish.

steps.headline: Add a dash of grenadine to make it a bloody screwdriver.
steps.description: Fill a glass with ice and 1 part of orange juice. Add 2¼ parts of vodka and a dash of grenadine. Garnish it with a thin orange slice before serving. The grenadine will give the screwdriver that red, "bloody" tint.

text:
Making a Basic Screwdriver Fill a highball glass with ice. You can use as much or as little ice as you'd like. If you are worried about the ice diluting the flavor, use some ice cubes made from frozen orange juice instead. Add some vodka. You can use any type of vodka you like, but you might want to use a better quality, as a lower-quality one will stand out. If you find that vodka has too sharp of a taste for you, try using an orange-flavored vodka instead. Top it off with orange juice. How much orange juice you add is up to you. Keep in mind that the more juice you add, the weaker the drink will become. Give it a stir. When the Screwdriver was first invented, it was stirred with whatever the workers had on hand: an actual screwdriver. You might want to use a spoon, straw, or stir stick for this. Garnish with an orange slice or a maraschino cherry. This is entirely optional, but it will help dress up an otherwise simple drink and make it look more interesting. Serve and enjoy the drink. It pairs great with greasy, breakfast type foods, such as bacon and scrambled eggs. You can also enjoy it with something salty, like pretzels. Making Variations Try it with a flavored vodka. A Screwdriver is a very simple drink. You can add some complexity to it by using a flavored vodka (as opposed to plain or orange-flavored). Just about anything tropical will go well with the orange juice. Here are some popular choices to get you started:
Lemon
Melon
Pineapple

Use a thin orange slice for garnish. For some kick, make it an Electric Screwdriver by add energy drink and tequila. Fill a glass with ice, then add ¾ ounce (22 milliliters) of tequila, ¾ ounce (22 milliliters) of vodka, and 2 ounces (60 milliliters) of orange juice. Top it off with 1 ounce (30 milliliters) of your favorite energy drink. Garnish it with an orange slice before serving. Add some sage for an herbal screwdriver. Muddle a sage leaf with 1 shot of vodka in a cocktail shaker. Add 5 ounces (150 milliliters) of orange juice, a dash of Angostura bitters, and some ice. Shake to mix. Fill a glass with ice, and pour the mixture through a strainer over it. Use a sprinkle of freshly-ground nutmeg as garnish. Add a dash of grenadine to make it a bloody screwdriver. Fill a glass with ice and 1 part of orange juice. Add 2¼ parts of vodka and a dash of grenadine. Garnish it with a thin orange slice before serving. The grenadine will give the screwdriver that red, "bloody" tint.
